```{r data cleaning}
#| message: false
# Import
df <- read_excel("./Muther Research Group - General/PSC manuscript 2025/PSC_9-20-19 thru 4-18-25_pulled 4-21-25.xlsx")
# Fill down MRN, select columns, remove duplicates
df <- df %>%
  fill(`Pat Mrn Id`, .direction = "down") %>%
  select(
    `Pat Mrn Id`, `Payor Name`, `AGE AT CONTACT`, `Internalizing subscale`,
    `Attention subscale`, `Externalizing subscale`, Score
  ) %>%
  # pivot_wider(names_from = `Payor Name`,values_from = `Payor Name`)
  distinct(`Pat Mrn Id`, `AGE AT CONTACT`, .keep_all = T)
# Convert to numeric
df$`AGE AT CONTACT` <- as.numeric(df$`AGE AT CONTACT`)
df$`Internalizing subscale` <- as.numeric(df$`Internalizing subscale`)
df$`Attention subscale` <- as.numeric(df$`Attention subscale`)
df$`Externalizing subscale` <- as.numeric(df$`Externalizing subscale`)
df$Score <- as.numeric(df$Score)
# Make age group
df$`Age Group` <- cut(df$`AGE AT CONTACT`,
  breaks = c(-Inf, 6, 10, Inf),
  labels = c("Age < 6", "Age >= 6 and < 10", "Age >= 10"), right = F
)
# Set table options
mycontrols <-
  tableby.control(
    numeric.stats = c("N", "Nmiss", "medianq1q3", "range"),
    cat.stats = c("N", "Nmiss", "countpct")
  )
```

# Score summary

## At first visit

```{r results='asis'}
first_visit <- df %>%
  group_by(`Pat Mrn Id`) %>%
  slice_min(`AGE AT CONTACT`)
t1 <- tableby(
  `Age Group` ~ `Internalizing subscale` + `Attention subscale` +
    `Externalizing subscale` + Score,
  data = first_visit
)
summary(t1, pfootnote = T)
```

## All visits

The table below treats multiple visits from the same participant as independent.

```{r results='asis'}
t1 <- tableby(
  `Age Group` ~ `Internalizing subscale` + `Attention subscale` +
    `Externalizing subscale` + Score,
  data = df
)
summary(t1, pfootnote = T)
```
